Text.Value: Can you tell us what happened?
Don't listen to him, kid - we've got you.
O-okay. Let's do that, please.
Oh, we are, are we?
And it can be anything you want. I promise.
Hey, hey - shh, all right? Look at me - it's gonna be okay.
They're too scared to come here anyway. We'd have better luck with the Guild.
We can't get involved with this.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hushed/almost a little angry at his friend

Text.Value: Just until he has somewhere better to go.
When I found them again - when I came back - they were lying here...

EditorData.NodeContext: Through tears; almost starts properly crying again

Text.Value: I know you do, kid. I know. Tell you what...
I'm scared. Why won't they get up? Why...
We'll try and find someone who can help your ma and da and then we'll get you something to eat, all right?
Between the Steel Watch and the Stone Lord, the Guild have barely got the strength to look after their own.
Don't be such a heartless bastard.

EditorData.NodeContext: Snapping slightly (but trying not to seem to angry for the sake of the kid)

Text.Value: I-I got lost. I was following a kitty.
Mummy? Daddy? Please get up. Please!
You want to adopt it?
Shut up, would you?
And he's not an 'it'.
And have them lock us up for two murders we didn't do?
Kid's gonna need a family no matter what happens.
Shit. We need to tell the Flaming Fist - get this kid some help.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hushed/worried they're going to get in trouble

Text.Value: Hush, now - it's all right. We're gonna help you.
I want to go home...

EditorData.NodeContext: Through tears/sounding like he's about to sob again

Text.Value: I'm not! I just don't wanna get in trouble, that's all!
Help them? They're dead.
Good lad.

Synopsis: In a quiet street in brampton, two local thugs find a crying child, the corpse of their parents still warm on the ground.  The two civilian don't know what to do: the fist won't help, and the Guild is busy with the Stone Man.
